intro: Lippia maximiliani, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Lippia maximiliani is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
